description: Love the fact that MS made powershell an OSS cross-platform scripting utility. From the easy portability between OSes to the bash and cmd aliases, it's perfect. Is integrated well with system PATHs across devices, too.
We have already Bash, Zsh and others

description: not to recomended
Rather have bash
It is finaly time there is a good cross-platfrom scripting language and shell. PowerShell simplifies management by allowing the more junior admins to use only one tool.

I've tried a number of shells, ranging from bash, zsh, fish, and others, and I have to say, pwsh is a very fine shell. While it is rather slow compared to shells that are made specifically for Linux, PowerShell definitely gets the job done, and if you're used to using the .NET Core PowerShell on Windows, you'll feel right at home using it on Linux.
It loves me. No lie!

It won't do everything PowerShell in Windows does (who really expected it to?) but it will do some OS stuff like Get-Process, Invoke-WebRequest, and all the familiar helpful commands like "Get-Member", "select", "where", etc. 

One important difference: in Windows a lot of PowerShell commands are aliased with their rough bash equivalent (Get-Process is "ps", Get-ChildItem is "ls", etc.) but in this version since it's running from Terminal, the actual Linux commands are executed if the actual Linux commands are used.

It is running from Terminal, so this probably the coolest thing, now you can start to mix and match PowerShell and Bash commands, like grepping the output of PowerShell commands, or converting the raw text output of bash commands to PowerShell objects! 

Example:
ps | ConvertFrom-csv
summary: A wonderful hybrid of things normal people would have left alone
